info.title: UPS Track Alert API
info.description:
The UPS Track Alert API provides best in-class package tracking visibility with near real time event updates for an improved customer experience and stream line logistic management.
Updates are pushed to the user as soon as available with no constant polling required, thereby improving operational efficiency.

Key Business Values:
- **Enhanced Customer Experience**: Near Real-time tracking information increases transparency, leading to higher customer satisfaction and trust.
- **Operational Efficiency**: Eliminates the necessity for continuous polling, thus saving computational resources and improving system responsiveness.
- **Data-Driven Decision Making**: Access to timely data can help businesses optimize their supply chain and make informed logistics decisions.
- **Optimizing Cash Flow Through Near Real-Time Delivery Tracking**: Improve cash flow by knowing the deliveries occurred in near real time.
- **Mitigating Fraud and Theft through Near Real-Time Package Status Monitoring**: Reduce fraud and theft by knowing the status of the package.

servers.description: UPS Production CIE Oauth. This is for integration testing only and it will not create any subscription.

Product Info
Errors

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: - 'Standard' - Represents a standard subscription type that provides near real time updates on tracking status.

parameters.name: transId
parameters.description: An identifier unique to the request.

parameters.name: transactionSrc
parameters.description: Identifies the client/source application that is calling.

PartialSuccessExample.description: Example response that contains valid tracking number for which subscription created and invalid tracking numbers.

CompleteSuccessExample.description: Example response that contains valid tracking numbers for which subscription created.

errors.message: Locale is required. The Subscription request has been rejected.
Invalid token or token is not present.

404.description: URL does not exist or resource not found.

errors.message: The requested resource was not found.
The requested method is not allowed for this resource.

oauth2.description:
"Find your Client ID and Secret on your app info page.
1. Select \\\"Try It\\\"
2. In the Security section enter your Client ID and Secret.
3. Select \\\"Request Token\\\"
4. Enter any additional information in the Body and Parameters sections.
5. Select \\\"Send\\\" to execute your API request"

url.description:
It is an HTTP-based callback end point that is exposed by the client to receive event notification. This endpoint must be operational arround the clock to ensure no event notifications are missed.
If this endpoint is not continuously available, incoming events will be lost.

credentialType.description: It is an open-entry field that indicates type of credentials supported by the client.

credential.description: It is an opaque string meant for client authentication. If for any reason this credential changes then any event notification will fail until a new subscription is made.

Destination.description: The destination container related to the clients endpoint API. To which messages would be sent on an event on the package.

locale.description: Locale setting is composed of language code and country code, separated by an underscore. This field is reserved for future use.

countryCode.description: Represents the country code. This field is reserved for future use.

trackingNumberList.description: Represents list of tracking numbers in request.

items.description: Represents tracking numbers starting with '1Z', followed by 16 alphanummeric characters in request.

scanPreference.description: Represents scan/event preferences for the subscription endpoint, Place holder for Future use.

items.description: Represents scan/event preferences for the subscription endpoint, Place holder for Future use.

message.example: Locale is required. The Subscription request has been rejected.

ErrorMessage.description: The error response containing any errors that occurred

validTrackingNumbers.description: List of tracking numbers with successful subscription created.

invalidTrackingNumbers.description: List of tracking numbers associated with errors preventing subscription creation.

errors.description: The error response containing any errors that occurred.
